title: BAC Calculator
description: Calculate your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) based on drinks consumed, weight, gender, and time
metaDescription: Calculate your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) based on drinks consumed, weight, gender, and time. Estimate impairment level and time until sober.

disclaimer.title: Important Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: This calculator provides estimates only. BAC varies based on many factors. Never drink and drive. Legal limits vary by jurisdiction. Consult local laws and always err on the side of caution.

legalDisclaimer.title: Legal Disclaimer
legalDisclaimer.text: This calculator is for educational purposes only. Do not rely on it to determine if you can legally drive. Legal BAC limits vary by jurisdiction (0.08% in most US states, 0.05% in many countries, 0.00% for commercial drivers). Always use designated drivers or alternative transportation if you've been drinking.

info.title: About BAC
info.description: Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) is a measure of alcohol concentration in your bloodstream. It's expressed as a percentage - for example, 0.08% means 0.08 grams of alcohol per 100 milliliters of blood.
info.formula: This calculator uses the Widmark formula to estimate BAC based on alcohol consumed, body weight, gender, and time elapsed. The formula accounts for alcohol metabolism rate (approximately 0.015% BAC decrease per hour).

levels.minimal: Minimal effects, slight mood elevation, subtle changes in behavior
levels.mild: Mild impairment, relaxation, reduced coordination, lowered inhibitions
levels.moderate: Moderate impairment, reduced reaction time, impaired judgment, difficulty concentrating
levels.significant: Significant impairment, difficulty walking and balancing, slurred speech, poor decision making
levels.severe: Severe impairment, risk of alcohol poisoning, loss of consciousness, potential life-threatening condition

factors.weight: Body weight - heavier individuals typically have lower BAC from the same amount of alcohol
factors.gender: Gender - women typically reach higher BAC levels than men from the same amount of alcohol
factors.time: Time - the body metabolizes alcohol at approximately 0.015% BAC per hour
factors.food: Food consumption - eating before or while drinking slows alcohol absorption
factors.metabolism: Individual metabolism - varies based on genetics, medications, and health conditions
